results.title: Chief of Staff
results.description:
Signaloid provides a computing platform to quantify, transmit, and track data uncertainty dynamically and throughout computations in unmodified computing workloads. Our technologies are used in applications including materials modeling, autonomous systems, computational finance, machine learning, and noisy intermediate-scale quantum computing. Our team consists of contrarian engineers with combined research, engineering, and leadership experience from Apple, ARC, ARM, Bell Labs, CMU, University of Cambridge, EPFL, IBM Research, Max Planck, MIT, and NEC Labs. Find out more at https://signaloid.com and try out the Signaloid uncertainty-tracking computing platform by signing up for free at https://get.signaloid.io.

 

Role Description

In this role, you will work closely with the founder and CEO, supporting them operationally to deliver Signaloid's long-term vision through execution of our medium-term mission and strategies.

To succeed in this role, you will be someone who brings to the team the following attributes:

  • A self-motivated individual with a desire to learn about and contribute to supporting the CEO and executive team of a fast-paced technology startup.
  • An ability to take initiatives while actively working to understand the reality and constraints of your environment.

In this role, you will need to continuously grow your ability to achieve objectives including:

  • Continually improve your ability to identify the importance and urgency of tasks on the plate of both the CEO and the CEO's direct reports.
  • Always be willing to ask questions when in doubt and listen to all verbal and non-verbal cues in communications, to identify when you need to ask questions to find out more.
  • Build trust from the CEO and executive team, through your demonstration of success in identifying challenges that can be taken off the CEO's plate and resolving those challenges with the collaboration of relevant team members.
  • Participate with the CEO in all internal and external communications and implement and achieve continuous improvement in the effectiveness and efficiency of those communications.

Within a year in this role, you can expect to:

  • Grow the remit of your responsibilities.
  • Contribute to the company's strategic operations.
  • Lead strategic initiatives within the company.
  • Have the opportunity to contribute to and explore other opportunities within Signaloid based on your demonstrated performance.

Requirements

  • Demonstrable exceptional written communication in English
  • Demonstrable ability to understand and communicate technical topics to laypersons (you do not necessarily need an Engineering or Science degree)
  • Demonstrable understanding of Signaloid’s products based on the publicly-available information and from using our shipping products
  • Demonstrable knowledge of and ability to apply, known methods for categorizing and prioritizing tasks in a fast-paced high-consequence environment
  • Excellent facility with text processing, presentation, and graphic design and illustration tools
  • A willingness to listen to people until they feel understood
  • Honesty, empathy, and a willingness to see the world from the viewpoint of others

Additional Desirable Skills and Experience:

  • Working knowledge of at least one additional spoken language
  • Familiarity with GitHub’s project management tools
Our Recruiting Procedure
  • All positions require you to write a one-page cover letter (you can also substitute the cover letter for a snippet of code that will run on the signaloid.io platform; be creative!). We use the cover letter to screen for communication skills, as clear communication is essential in a remote working environment.
  • Applicants who pass the cover letter screening receive an initial 15-minute Zoom screening call with a member of our People Development Team to discuss your CV.
  • Applicants who pass the screening interview, regardless of the position they are interviewing for, will be given a real-world project to solve over the course of one week (or two weeks if you are currently employed in a full-time job). In exchange for your time, we give you two books relevant to the rest of the interview process and £500 worth of free credits on the Signaloid Cloud Developer Platform.
  • Applicants who successfully complete the project are invited for a set of 45-minute interviews with people from our core teams (there will be up to six such interviews) which will use the project you completed as a discussion point.
  • In the final stage, applicants are invited for an on-site interview with members of the team in Cambridge.

Benefits

A flexible remote-first work environment

  • Be part of an international team with the flexibility to choose where you live
  • You can work any set of eight hours in a day provided four of those hours overlap with the working day in Zurich
  • Join the rest of the team every three months for an in-person session somewhere in Europe

Competitive compensation

  • Yearly bonus based on company's Objectives and Key Results (OKR) performance and bi-yearly bonus based on your project team's OKR performance
  • Simple transparent compensation across the company, with four pay levels, in all roles, based on skill level: Contributor, Senior Contributor, Lead Contributor, and Principal Contributor
  • All full-time employees receive attractive stock options package

results.title: CRM & BI Analyst
results.description:
Join the early days of an organization advancing the tech startup ecosystem in Latin America!
 

At Latitud, we are focused on elevating the next generation of startups in Latin America. There is so much friction for startups and we truly believe that they are an incredible lever for economic progress and social mobility. We started as a community to help support founders and we have since evolved into a tech company that builds infrastructure to reduce friction for early stage startups so they can focus on their product and customers.

 

You could think of Latitud as the OS for startups in Latin America. So far, founders love us. Here’s what they have to say.

 

Latitud was created by Brian Requarth, who founded, scaled and sold Viva Real for US$600M, Gina Gotthilf, who led growth at Duolingo from 3M to 200M users, and Yuri Danilchenko, who scaled product & engineering at Kaszek-backed Escale.

 

Latitud is at a very exciting moment, we just raised a $11.5M Seed led by a16z and NfX and another $1.5M from the community. This means we are growing and you will have the opportunity to contribute to the strategy and culture we build together.

 

💻 The job:

You’ll be joining Latitud at a unique stage of hypergrowth before complexity eats anyone alive. As our first CRM & BI analyst, you will help the team leverage opportunities at touchpoints with different audiences, build the processes that will make our communications run smoothly and the dashboards that will support decisions across teams.

  • Map and automate journeys for our educational programs and products

  • Analyze and create new database segmentation based on the company’s objectives

  • Develop the data strategy required to support initiatives across teams (website, blog, surveys, testing, market research, etc).

  • Maintain best practices of template design, audience segmentation, list hygiene, and deliverability

  • Collaborate with the marketing team to coordinate campaigns' creative production

  • Identify opportunities to connect the different business units of the company

  • Develop and implement marketing tactics to activate, engage and convert customers

  • Identify opportunities to reach target segmentations of our database during campaigns

  • Build and track dashboards that help the team manage their goals

  • Act as the CRM functional point of contact for the Latitud team.

 

😎 You are:

  • Experienced in marketing and data. You have 3+ years of experience dealing with digital marketing, customer databases, and data analytics. You have had success implementing, testing, and iterating initiatives for reach and engagement at the product or company level.

  • A great problem solver. You prioritize outcomes, but also care about documenting processes. You use data to navigate challenges and find the easiest and fastest ways to solve them. You proactively identify gaps and ways of improving things without burdening the team.

  • Pragmatic and collaborative. You are quick to get feedback and ship things to production for real users – and you're not afraid to talk to them to make better decisions. You're always measuring the impact of your changes and helping your peers do the same. 

  • A fast learner. We don't expect you to know everything about our domain and stack, but we need you to catch up quickly.

  • Passionate about accessibility, diversity, and inclusion. Latitud is not a good fit for you if you are uncomfortable or annoyed by these topics.

  • Interested in being involved with the startup community. Startup founders in LATAM are our primary persona and you’re either interested in working with them or want to join their ranks in a few years.

Required Skills

  • Excellent communication skills, with the ability to translate complicated findings or technical approaches in easy-to-understand ways

  • Ability to draw data from multiple sources, such as Google Analytics, Hubspot, Airtable, Paperform, and other tools to analyze and build comprehensive reports

  • Experience with Hubspot CRM and its marketing features

  • Experience with automation tools such as Make and Zapier

Preferred Skills

  • Proficiency with performance dashboards such as Tableau, Looker, or similar software, and ability to design clean crisp visualizations

 

  👋 Why Latitud? You’ll love working with us if you want to...

  • Learn from the best minds in the ecosystem (entrepreneurs, VCs and operators at top startups).

  • Make a memorable difference in the trajectory of the next generation of world-class tech companies coming out of Latin America.

  • Be part of a mission-driven organization from its very early days, helping shape its future significantly.

  • Thrive in a flexible, innovation-focused environment that welcomes new ideas and tools.

  • Work alongside well-connected industry thought leaders.

  • Be part of an awesome team. Our small team is A+ :)

 

👎 Why not Latitud? You will not love working with us if you want to...

  • Work at an established, process-oriented, 9-5 company with a well-defined role.

  • Find problems but not jump to help solve them.

  • Have a very clear career ladder at your next job rather than help build it.

 

Benefits

  • Work from anywhere (100% remote)

  • Generous equity

  • Health insurance covered 100% (including dependents)

  • Monthly Co-working allowance or annual Home Office bonus

  • Generous parental leave and paid vacation

  • Two international team trips per year on us!

results.title: Business Analyst for Risk
results.description:
Lead a thoughtful and data-driven Risk analytics function. Start out by defining not where ADDI is but where ADDI belongs. Attack a problem identified within the business and reach ground-breaking results in an exceptional way, having end-to-end ownership and delivery along the way.

You are a self-starter and a creative problem-solver; You not only crunch numbers but also effectively tie your analytical insights to the greater business objectives. You are a fast learner quickly able to adapt to all that Risk analytics should cover (Credit, Fraud, Collections). You have a bias towards action and crave lots of responsibility and ownership, which will include:

  • Becoming a subject matter expert in our data and our portfolio, with ability to identify, analyze, and interpret trends in complex data sets.
  • Developing effective portfolio monitoring tools, including company-facing dashboards and internal/external presentations.
  • Collaborating closely with other departments including Data Science, Finance, Capital Markets, and Sales to deliver Risk metrics and recommendations that support overall company growth.
  • Mentoring/managing junior analysts and interns.

Requirements

  • At least 1-2 years’ experience in risk
  • English proficiency
  • Ability to handle large datasets using SQL and other programming languages
  • Strong analytical mindset with ability to collect, organize, analyze, and interpret significant amounts of information accurately
  • Clear, effective written and oral communication skills
  • Ability to see the larger picture and think strategically
  • Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment

Desired qualifications

  • R or Python
  • Data science knowledge
  • Previous Fraud experience
  • Previous startup experience

Benefits

  • Be at the center of it all. We are a true fintech, and finance is at the core of what we do.
  • Massive market opportunity ahead of us; we are growing faster than pretty much any other fintech lender was at our stage.
  • Work alongside a great and diverse team that cares about what we are doing and how we are doing it.
  • Generous compensation, including equity, 100% health insurance (and 50% for dependents), flexible time-off, learning budget, and visa sponsorship for foreigners.

results.title: SR. BUSINESS ANALYST
results.description:
More Than Just A Job, We Offer An Opportunity To Grow! Our project team is exploring to recruiting a Business Analyst to build a future in Reiz Tech!
Reiz Tech is Expanding and Hiring Globally! Growth Is In Our DNA and We Will Help You Grow!


ABOUT THE ROLE

 

The Business Analyst works with stakeholders from crucial business and technical units to understand business needs and priorities, help choose the best solution option, and define requirements for solutions that deliver value. This role requires the individuals to act as an intermediary between stakeholder groups and ensure that business requirements are met when building IT solutions.

 

 

 

ABOUT THE CLIENT

 

One of the biggest financial institutions in Lithuania.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Establish strong working relationships with stakeholders, both business and technical (e.g. developers, solution architects, and UX/UI designers).

  • Gather information from stakeholders and other sources to specify and model requirements.

  • Analyze the requirements’ dependencies, and maintain requirements’ traceability to product goals and solution components.

  • Communicate requirements and potential value to developers and stakeholders.

  • Create and maintain the Product Backlog, and support the Product Owner to build a Product Roadmap.

  • Support Quality Assurance Specialists to ensure the overall quality of the solution.

  • Participate in Scrum ceremonies.

  • Agree and develop a minimal level of solution documentation.

 

  • Strong ability to communicate with business and IT representatives at all levels of the organization.

  • Ability to elicit, isolate and interpret business needs.

  • Knowledge of techniques to design requirements and skills to choose appropriate ones.

  • Experience capturing requirements for complex IT solutions within a compliance-oriented environment.

  • Understanding the software development lifecycle, especially Agile software development.

  • Ability to balance priorities among competing needs.

  • Curiosity and willingness to learn.

  • Ability to communicate well in both English and Lithuanian languages.

 

ADVANTAGES

  • Experience working in financial or fintech organizations.

  • Tertiary or vendor-aligned technical qualifications covering general business analysis (e.g. University IT or Business degree, certification, e.g. PMI-PBA, CBAP).

  • Understanding the database concepts.

  • Ability to read and interpret XML and XSD documents.

results.title: Sr. Business Analyst, AEM
results.description:
Location: Anywhere USA

TA Digital is a digital transformation agency with 30-40% growth year-over-year focused on hiring leaders within the digital marketing space to support growth and build a scalable foundation for the future. Our vision is to provide innovative digital solutions and services by continuing to expand our leadership team and hiring superstars who may feel lost or marginalized within their current organizations.

If you feel:

  • there are too many layers between you and decision makers
  • that your current organization will not make the right decision even after you identify problems and recommend viable solutions
  • you are ready for a bigger voice, larger platform or place for a stronger impact

…then you should consider TA Digital because we are ready to talk to you!

Description:

The Sr. Business Analyst (AEM) is a highly motivated individual with strong technical and communication skills who leverages data to create impactful analysis and reporting to help inform strategic initiatives. The ideal candidate will be able to work collaboratively across a diverse team to gather business requirements and conduct process mapping to facilitate the documentation and automation of product and system requirements. This is a dynamic role in a growth organization with direct exposure to corporate strategy and will work closely with Business, UX, Development, QA and Off-Shore resources as a thought partner daily.

Responsibilities:

  • Obtains the big picture of the product and release vision
  • Understand current business processes and define future business processes
  • Work with multiple simultaneous projects by identifying requirements, facilitating change management, impact analysis, supporting execution team
  • Client engagement:
  • Engage stakeholders, facilitate workshops, conduct client interviews to define business goals and elicit business requirements
  • Prioritize requirements collaboratively with business stakeholders, UX and technology disciplines
  • Define and document business requirements, functional requirements and process flows/ modelling
  • Determine documentation needs based on the project requirements and manage the documentation efforts
  • Collaborate with Creative team and ensure that User Experience and Visual Design align with Functional Requirements
  • Provide requirement inputs during technical design sessions, review design deliverables for consistency and as a source of requirements
  • Ensure that project team has clear understanding of functional requirements and business expectations
  • Work with QA teams to develop testing strategy, test plan, identify test cases and participate in UAT
  • Conduct training session for a product or an implementation
  • Create product documentation and training material including user manuals

Requirements

  • Bachelor’s Degree required (Business or Digital Marketing) Master's degree (preferred)
  • Experience working in the digital agency or consulting firm space
  • Minimum 5+ years of experience as Business Analyst, Functional Analyst or Proxy Product Owner
  • An agile BA with a strategic, functional, technical and relationship focused approach
  • Experience working with cross functional teams in transition projects with competitor vendors
  • Ability in working with both onsite and offshore teams in distributed agile
  • Familiar with use of collaborative tools preferably confluence
  • Experience in platforms for Content Management
  • Can work with multiple integration points for a technology stack:
    • WCM/CMS Adobe: AEM required
    • Adobe Analytics, Target, Audience Manager, DAM is a strong plus
    • SFMC (Salesforce Marketing Cloud / Exact Target), SEO is beneficial
  • Understanding of templates, components and authoring requirements in a CMS
  • Advanced understanding of Site SEO requirements, benchmarking and audit in stage and live environments.
  • Great communication and interpersonal skills and stakeholder management
  • Good research, product demo and presentation skills

Benefits

Compensation:

The salary range listed is for informational purposes. TA Digital treats all applicants as individuals taking into consideration but not limited to their professional and academic experience, specialized training, certifications and associated responsibilities as it relates to our specific industry. The salary range listed is just one component of our total compensation package for each unique employee. An estimated base salary of $115K – $150K plus a variable component is anticipated for this role in the US.

Benefits: Global Health, Dental, Vision, AD&D Insurance, Vacation / PTO / Holiday pay plus matching 401K, Tuition & Travel Expense Reimbursement as needed

About us:

TA Digital is the only global boutique agency that delivers the “best of both worlds” to clients seeking to achieve organizational success through digital transformation. Unlike smaller, regional agencies that lack the ability to scale or large organizations that succumb to a quantity-over-quality approach, we offer resource diversity while also providing meticulous attention to the details that enable strategic success.

Over the past 20 years, TA Digital has positioned clients to achieve digital maturity by focusing on data, customer-centricity and exponential return on investment; by melding exceptional user experience and data-driven methodologies with artificial intelligence and machine learning, we enable digital transformations that intelligently build upon the strategies we set into motion. We are known as a global leader that assists marketing and technology executives in understanding the digital ecosystem while identifying cultural and operational gaps within their business - ultimately ushering organizations toward a more mature model and profitable digital landscape.

Recognized in 2013, 2014, 2015, 2019, 2020, 2021 and 2022 Inc. 5000 list as one of the most successful technology companies in the United States, TA Digital is pleased also to share high-level strategic partnerships with world class digital experience platform companies like Adobe, SAP and Salesforce and possess global partnerships with industry leaders such as Sitecore, Episerver, Elastic Path, BigCommerce, AWS, Azure and Coveo.

TA Digital has offices in US, Canada, UK and India. For more information, visit: www.tadigital.com

EOE & OFCCP Compliant regardless of: Minority / Female / Veteran / Disabled / Sexual Orientation / Gender Identity / National Origin

Apply Here: https://apply.workable.com/ta-digital/j/5C26038E03/

results.title: Business Analyst II
results.description:
Business Analyst II

Are you the one we’re looking for?
Diverse Computing, Inc. is seeking highly motivated entry- to mid-level technical Business Analysts to join our team. This is an immediate opening, and it will be available to candidates seeking remote or hybrid (office/remote) working opportunities. This Business Analyst will be responsible for leading and executing complex business analysis activities. The focus of this position is to work closely with our criminal justice and public safety clients to fully understand their business processes and translate information into clear system requirements for the project team. Please note that this is NOT a data analyst type of position. Rather, this role requires the ability to understand complex technical and business processes, demonstrate excellent problem-solving skills, and provide outstanding customer service. Responsibilities will also include interfacing with management to achieve project goals and objectives while supporting other members of the project team. We believe our project teams should be one step ahead, proactively asking questions and acting in the interest of the client as well as the company's success.

Get to know us a little.

At Diverse Computing, we are passionate about making a difference. Our mission: Deliver innovative solutions that improve the effectiveness and security of the public safety community. In other words, we create software that has a higher purpose than simply making a profit. Imagine working for a company where you can take ownership of your projects, be an integral part of team-oriented innovation, and play a pivotal role with software that is designed to improve public safety. At Diverse Computing, these aren't just catch phrases... they are part of our everyday reality, and yes, we're proud of it!



As a Business Analyst II, you will:

  • Assume leadership responsibilities as assigned by the project leader
  • Achieve project goals and objectives through project management team coordination
  • Engage in and produce quality analytical work and deliverables, including:
    - Facilitating needs assessment and investigative gathering of business requirements from project stakeholders
    - Strategic planning; risk identification and developing mitigation strategies
    - Preparing for and leading status meetings
    - Eliciting systems requirements and utilizing requirements matrices
    - Defining elements of system design
    - Developing process models, diagrams, BPMN, and mockups
    - Tracking project tasks and action items
    - Creating status reports
    - Scheduling updates
    - Creating test plans and scripts
  • Be responsible for learning DCI’s products, how to troubleshoot issues, interpret logs, and correct issues within those products
  • Perform quality assurance testing for Diverse Computing products, including system testing, reporting issues, coordinating with technical resources, and confirming that software issues are resolved prior to delivery to the client
  • Be committed to expanding your technical skills, including XML and XSLT
  • Support DCI customers through hosting DCI product system training sessions and workshops, both in-person and in online settings
  • Assist in the Agile/Scrum development process, including:
    - Decomposing IT concepts into Scrum user stories with detailed acceptance criteria and mockups as necessary
    - Assisting in managing and prioritizing product backlog
    - Participating in Agile sprints, performing testing to ensure acceptance criteria are met

Success factors generally include a/an:

  • Strong Type A personality
  • High degree of pride in accuracy, attention to detail, organization, confidentiality, and humble confidence
  • Analytical mindset with excellent problem-solving skills
  • Satisfaction and enjoyment derived from detailed planning and time management
  • Natural talent for leadership and professionalism
  • Talent for tactfully and effectively communicating both positive and constructive feedback
  • Ability to truly listen when communicating with others and reflectively responding to needs
  • Proactive approach to strategic planning
  • High level of comfort when leading meetings and presenting to a group
  • Dedication to teamwork, and cooperation
  • High regard for taking responsibility and ownership of one’s own work and actions
  • Strong work ethic and internal drive to accurately and effectively meeting deadlines
  • Knack for thriving in a fast-paced environment and demonstrating responsible decisiveness
  • Affinity for service-oriented helpfulness
  • Talent for productive and solution-oriented conflict resolution
  • Personal passion for, or interest in, supporting criminal justice and law enforcement agencies
  • Desire to lead by example through living the DCI core values of integrity, passion, customer service, innovation, and engagement

Requirements

This job might be for you, if you:

  • Have a minimum of a Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Information Communication Technology, Management Information Systems, Computer Science, or a similar degree program (related work experience may be substituted for educational requirement)
  • Have 3-5 yrs of professional experience
  • Have a strong understanding of information technology, database, and software development concepts
  • Have excellent verbal, non-verbal, and written communication skills
  • Have experience planning and facilitating project meetings
  • Have experience leading, coaching, and mentoring less experienced business analysts
  • Have experience working with technical team members to provide direction and clarification as needed
  • Have experience providing management-level reporting on project work
  • Are knowledgeable with Agile / Scrum
  • Have some experience with Linux/Unix, Windows, and data networks (this is desirable but not required)
  • Have knowledge of the public safety or criminal justice industry (this is desirable but not required)
  • Currently reside in one of these states: CO, CT, FL, IL, MA, NC, NJ, NY, SC, SD, TN, TX, UT
  • Can confidently pass rigorous fingerprint-based state and federal background screenings, as required by the nationwide agencies we work with (mandatory)
  • Do not require sponsorship to work in the U.S.; sponsorship is not available for this position
  • Are comfortable working remotely both autonomously and within a team

Benefits

Here at Diverse Computing, we understand that highly satisfied employees are key to achieving not only our goals, but the goals of our employees.
This is why we offer:

  • Competitive salary (dependent on level of experience)
  • 100% coverage of monthly health care insurance premiums for yourself or 60% discount on dependent plan premiums
  • 100% coverage of monthly life, dental, & vision insurance premiums for yourself
  • Flexible Spending Account (FSA) for health-related expenses
  • Supplemental insurance options: life, AD&D, short & long term disability coverage
  • Up to 3% matching retirement contributions
  • 15 days of annually earned PTO
  • Paid sick leave
  • 9 paid holidays annually
  • Flex Scheduling, including fully remote & hybrid (office/remote) work opportunities
  • Reimbursement of approved business-related travel & professional development expenses
  • Last, but not least, loving your job! An award-winning company culture that’s welcoming, fun, collaborative, & supportive. Find out more at https://www.diversecomputing.com

 

Ready to apply?

    • Click on the link below to start the application process
    • Provide a current resume as either a PDF or MS Word document
    • Include a cover letter that contains contact information for three (3) professional references
    • Keep an eye on your email and its spam folder since that will be our primary method of communication

We are an equal opportunity employer that values diversity; it's in our name! We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex (including pregnancy, sexual orientation, or gender identity), national origin, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, or genetic information (including family medical history).

results.title: Senior Operations Manager
results.description:
Floom is a fast-moving startup, working on multiple continents over multiple time zones. As such, we require a superstar Senior Operations Manager to act as a vital part in the cross-functional work at Floom, building and managing relationships between Product, Sales and Ops.

As a member of the Marketplace Ops leadership team, you will drive strategic, analytical and operational projects to improve the bottom line. We are looking for an exceptional individual to join Floom to lead our marketplace operations, overseeing our commercial and operation goals. You must be extremely solutions-driven, detail-oriented, mission-aligned, and excited to work in a startup environment.

Excel, ZenDesk, Notion and Google Sheets will be your bread and butter, and you’ll love to suggest improvements to operational processes.



Your Responsibilities:

  • Overall responsibility for the operations team, covering both B2B, B2C and customer support
  • Line management, coaching and development of operations team individuals
  • Liaise with and maintain relationships with outsourced teams & suppliers
  • Provide feedback and solutions on standard operating procedures for everyday situations. Creating automations to better existing manual processes.
  • Manage the Customer service team and processes
  • Identify and act to remove obstacles to delivering consistently high levels of service across both our B2B and B2C offerings

results.title: Operations Manager
results.description:
JOB TITLE: Operations Manager

DIVISION: Nuclear

LOCATION OF WORK: 

Remote – based in one of the following states:

  • Colorado
  • Florida
  • Idaho
  • Minnesota
  • New Jersey
  • New Mexico
  • North Carolina
  • Ohio
  • Oregon
  • Tennessee
  • Utah
  • Virginia
  • Washington D.C.
  • Washington

TRAVEL EXPECTATIONS: Must be willing to relocate to the to-be-determined U.S. MMR facility location.

DESCRIPTION:

The Operations Manager reports to the Manager, Reactor Manufacturing. The Operations Manager responsibilities include:

  • Develop Manufacturing Management Frameworks & Systems for Manufacturing Team; MRP, Maintenance, Lean, CI, HPI,DFA, DFM, Change Control, etc.
  • MRP System Implementation, Financial Planning (CAPEX, OPEX), production scheduling, work cell planning, procurement, etc.
  • Workforce planning & development Skill Set Identification, training program development, integration with local educational institutions
  • Factory & Manufacturing Systems testing and acceptance programs
  • Prototype assembly processes and systems
  • Develop and implement Manufacturing assurance, oversight of manufacturing governance programs


MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES:

The main responsibilities and authorities for the Operations Manager are:

  • Manufacturing Integration: The Operations Manager is responsible for developing programs, processes and procedures for all aspects of MMR manufacturing including process design, quality assurance, facilities engineering, manufacturing engineering, tool and equipment design, information technology, safety, product development, Lean Six-Sigma, and machinery maintenance. They support Design Engineering in manufacturing process Research and Development, including prototype construction and testing.
  • Must have a broad understanding of all manufacturing processes, with the ability to choose optimized production methods.
  • Must be able to perform break even analyses based on cost, quantity, and other risk factors.
  • Extensive experience in the NQA-1 quality environment, including qualification and commercial grade dedication.
  • Work under both DOE and NRC regulatory oversite a plus.
  • Factory Readiness: As a key member of the Factory Readiness Team, the Operations Manager works closely with Core Division, Construction, Customers, Supply Chain and Logistics to develop and implement integrated corporate systems needed to manage, design, construct, develop the workforce, establish supply chains, commission, and operate the MMR manufacturing facility leveraging standardized and repeatable systems and processes. These systems will ensure that USNC can rapidly deploy manufacturing facilities, manufacture high-quality nuclear components, meet regulatory and quality requirements, meet production goals and do so in a safe, environmentally sound, and financially responsible manner.
  • 20 years o more supply chain management experience is required.
  • Framework Developer: Develops the supply chain structure at the highest levels, including make or buy, sourcing strategies, equipment purchases, and site interfaces and boundaries.
  • Extensive supplier development experience including supplier: identification, support, quality support, and scheduling.
  • Value Engineering: As part of the product and production development phase the manufacturing integration leader works closely with Design Engineering to develop parts, subassemblies and systems that not only meet performance requirements, but are repeatable, interchangeable, and economically producible.
  • Finance: As Manufacturing Integration leader, they work with Finance and the controller to develop and maintain both overhead and project budgets. They develop Basis of Estimates and assist in the proposal process. They are familiar with working in an earned value management system of budgeting and accounting. They implement labor optimization strategies.
  • Staffing: The manufacturing integration manager is also responsible for establishing and developing a management staff for the integration group to include managers of Industrial/Facilities Engineering, QA, Manufacturing Engineering, Information Engineering (IT), Lean Six-Sigma, site specific Integration Managers, Safety and Nuclear Safety.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Must possess a BS or BA minimum in Manufacturing Technology, Engineering, Business or a related field. An MBA is preferred.
  • Extensive experience developing and managing Manufacturing Engineering and design of nuclear manufacturing processes for nuclear-grade components and systems. Experience must include implementation of ERP/MRP systems.
  • Experience developing and converting to paperless manufacturing and supply chain processes.
  • Extensive experience managing nuclear facility business systems, manufacturing operations, and associated programs, processes, and procedures including corrective action and root cause analysis programs.
  • Minimum 20 years of Management or Leadership experience in a nuclear environment including experience with Nuclear Safety Culture, Safety Conscious Work Environment, Lean Enterprise Systems, DFA/DFMA, Integrated Safety Management Systems (ISMS), and Design for Six Sigma
  • Strong commitment to employee safety and well-being

PREFERRED SKILLS & EXPERIENCES:

  • Proven ability to implement Lean manufacturing methodology in new and existing production settings. The aptitude to develop Lean practices both at the cell level and factory wide, in both manufacturing and office process settings.
  • Extensive knowledge of Nuclear Safety Systems, Nuclear Change Evaluation, and working in NRC Nuclear licensed and regulated environments
  • Experience developing and implementing Assurance Programs; both NQA-1 and ISO 9001 quality programs and processes, Contractor Assurance, Conduct of Operations/Readiness, and the Software Management Programs.
  • Knowledge of EVMS (Earned Value Management Systems) including budget development and maintenance, (CAM) control account management, and proforma financial forecasting.
  • Understanding of records management and document control (RMDC) systems.
  • Candidate must be a Qualified Six-Sigma Black Belt
  • Must have working knowledge or be familiar with SharePoint, Microsoft Office Suite
  • Have effective communication skills and understanding of the corporate culture with an ability to influence key stakeholders and decision makers across USNC
  • Exceptional leadership, communication, problem solving, and conflict resolution skills
  • Proficient in computer skills and possess the ability to effectively use various analytical, design, project management, and presentation computer programs
  • Required: Data analysis and Statistical skills. Experience with Minitab or other statistical analysis tools.
  • Have excellent verbal, written communication, and time management skills
  • Advanced technical writing skills: develop policies, procedures, guides, and program description documents.
  • Have a strong orientation toward internal and external customers
  • Work with other departments to increase overall strength of the group and company
  • Must be an excellent negotiator and motivator.
  • Possess excellent verbal and writing skills to effectively communicate with others
  • Effectively manage, supervise, motivate, direct, coordinate and provide guidance to the staff of the departments
  • Must be able to not only manage but lead large cross-functional teams of personnel in disbursed locations, and multicultural environments.
  • Possess the ability to influence and motivate stakeholders who are not under your direct operational control.
  • Resolve project and operational issues
  • Analyze and solve problems daily
  • The ability to balance analysis and urgency when making decisions where all of the data may not be readily available.
  • Maintains collaborative, courteous, and respectful relationships
  • Ability to foster a collaborative team environment

TO APPLY:

Please include the following in your application in PDF format:

  • Cover Letter
  • Resume

EXPORT CONTROL REQUIREMENTS:

To confirm to U.S. Government space technology export regulations, including the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) you must be a U.S. citizen, lawful permanent resident of the U.S., or a protected individual as defined by 8 U.S.C. 1324b(a)(3).

  • Are you legally authorized to work in the United States?
  • Will you now or in the future require sponsorship for an immigration-related employment benefit (e.g., H-1B, TN, green card, etc.)?

EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYMENT:

USNC embraces diversity and equal opportunity and is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are striving to build the diverse, equitable, and inclusive workforce that will make our technology a reality. USNC actively encourages applicants from historically underrepresented backgrounds to apply to this and other roles, acknowledging and committing to address the historical lack of diversity within the nuclear and aerospace industries.

USNC does not discriminate based on race, color, religion, gender, national origin/ethnicity, veteran status, disability status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, mental or physical disability, or any other legally protected status.

ABOUT ULTRA SAFE NUCLEAR:

Based in Seattle, Ultra Safe Nuclear Corporation (USNC) develops nuclear hardware and services for reliable, clean energy anywhere on Earth and in space. USNC offers full-stack capabilities including specialized reactor design services, advanced materials and fuel development, and reactor manufacturing and system deployment.

USNC has offices in USA, Canada, France, Korea, Poland, South Africa, the UK and more.

results.title: Senior Operations Lead
results.description:
Australia or U.S timezone | Work from anywhere policy | Full-time | Operations do-er and Leader | Meaningful company stock

 

Are you our Wizard of Ozps?

We're looking for an operational wizard who understands all of the challenges, magic and levers to pull behind the scenes, to create something truly magical (minus any wicked witches).

 

About Lived

Our mission Lived is on a mission to radically change the way people access and experience support for overcoming some of life's toughest challenges—starting with alcohol.

Our vision We believe the future of health support is peer-led and science-backed, because there can be no greater or more compassionate teacher than lived experience. We know that by connecting people with others' lived experiences, we can better support them to reach their goals faster and with greater care.

What is Lived? Lived is an app that supports people to drink less and live more, by connecting them with the support, wisdom and guidance of people who have been there themselves and understand what works.

 

✨ About the role

As Lived's Wizard of Ops, you will…

Transform Lived into a well-oiled engine: As a Senior Operations Lead, you are an expert handle cranker, always on the lookout for ways to improve how things work across all functions at Lived.

⚙ Build and grow the heart of the platform—our content machine: You'll be owning the full lifecycle of the content experience: recruiting, training, onboarding and incentivising creators, through to scaling and optimising content creation processes and monitoring. Figuring out what to optimise, which levers to pull, and when, will be your craft.

‍ Translate our vision into action: Lived has huge global ambitions. ****You'll be tasked with breaking down the vision into actionable, efficient and effective plans that empower and operationalise all teams at Lived. You will take complex projects and contextualise, structure, and wrap them up in a bloody big ribbon. You love your numbers, you're super analytical and you make calls that are driven by insight, nuance and data. This is quite an operationally technical role so will need to be comfortable with technology, excel, automation tools, and mentoring data analysts— and you won't mind getting your hands dirty if needed.

Be the glue that bands us together: You will grow and drive operational excellence at Lived. This will include helping the team set, align and track OKR's; supporting the company and CEO with strategic planning, financial reporting and budgeting (via accountants); and making sure to keep us safe and out of trouble (working with our lawyers on legal contracts, liabilities and risk mitigation). You will be agile in your approach, and won't be phased by the challenges that start-up life throws at you…

 

Let's talk about you.

  • ⭐ You're a born leader

    The scope is broad and bright, and the potential for growth to a Leadership role is huge. That doesn't faze you. You will naturally be the type of human that wants to have an outsized impact in the business. One: because you want to grow, but two: because you have likely done it before and are a strong generalist.

  •  You eat collaboration for breakfast

    While you will thrive on this huge mountain to climb, you won't run this trek solo. You'll collaborate incredibly closely with our cross-functional team. You will have support from our Community Lead, Arielle, who is the brightest human rallying our Guide and member communities, our Head of Marketing, Lauren who will not rest until we build one of the most human and accessible brands on the planet, and our Head of Product Ridhi who's excellent at both dreaming up the most ambitious product vision while being so grounded in executing it. This powerhouse team having your back will not only ensure sure you succeed but will grow you personally and professionally in ways the English language has no words for.

  • You can do this in your sleep, (you have done this type of role before)

    You have some battle scars either personally and/or professionally that have allowed you to grow. To others, tasks you commit to seem like they will take a week, then you pop up in Slack saying "done, folks" hours later. You wow the team with most things you do, but sometimes you mess up, and that is ok. You're likely someone who has had some experience building a marketplace, being a leader, being a life-long learner and you have experienced first-hand, the highs and lows of rapid growth.

    To be overly transparent on this one, we really need people who have done a similar role before, at scale, in tech, and preferably globally.

  • You're a role model and you lead with pride

    You are comfortable and skilled at leading to ensure everyone is engaged, effective, and growing. You're a natural connector and are able to bring cross-functional groups together to elevate outcomes. Your crystal ball vision helps you stay a few steps ahead and you proactively seek to fill gaps in your knowledge. You have this odd but profound ability to anticipate problems most do not know will exist.

  • ❤ You care, a lot

    Like a-lot, a-lot. You will often hear the expression "be a good human" at Lived. (i.e. don't eat the last cookie in the cookie jar without filling it up. If something takes your teammate 30 minutes and you 3 minutes, do it for them. And if you know someone is nervous about a big preso, volunteer private time so they can practice with you). These random acts of goodness should come naturally to you, without overt thought or thinking of "wow I really went out of my way". It's just how you are wired.

  • You're practical & anchored

    You are likely a COO type or not far off, but actually - you have decided you miss getting your hands dirty and you want to scale again with a company FULL of energy, vision, and mission. You're comfortable zooming into and executing the detail, and also has the sixth sense of knowing when to zoom out and think strategy.

  • Self-aware and vulnerable

    This role is larger than life and we don't believe in unicorns. In order to be successful you will need to know your strengths and weaknesses, ruthlessly prioritise tasks and outsource/delegate when needed.

  • ❌ Let's talk about the things we don't value
    ❌ No narcissistic traits/self importance/arrogance
    ❌ People that talk at us, instead of with us
    ❌ Cares more about being right than getting it right

Why join?
  • Work with purpose and pride: Knowing that your efforts will genuinely change lives around the world for the better.
  • Work at a global, seed-stage startup with the goal of successfully scaling operations: Where you get to be a part of genuinely shaping the future of the product, culture and business. We have a small team and flexible environment making it easy to rapidly iterate.
  • Work from anywhere: We are a fully-remote, flexible (and awesome) team.
  • Learn from the best: Join a diverse team of people from Uber, eBay, Canva, Secure Code Warrior and more.
Highlights

Backed by top investors including Folklore, Antler, Airtree, Simon Griffiths (Co-Founder & CEO of Who Gives A Crap), and more.

Featured in the Australian Financial Review as one to watch.

Partnered with Monash University, The Buttery, Australian Federal Government and other industry leaders.

Founder: CEO & Founder Sally Krebs is one of the youngest (and most fierce) CEO's in the global Social Impact Start-up community—having founded Lived at just 27. Read her story here.

 

What else is in it for you?

We believe people do their best work when they are healthy and happy.

  • Purpose

    Be part of a movement that is changing lives and changing the future of addiction for good

  • Work anywhere. Live your life.

    Join us anywhere in the world as part of a fully distributed team.

    No commuting! We give you the freedom and flexibility to work when you want and where you want (as long as there is enough overlap for key meetings with our team in the U.S. and Australia).

    This is not vanity flexibility. Our engineers often go surfing at lunchtime for a few hours.

  • ‍♂ Training

    Your colleagues are a few of the best people on the planet to drive you towards being the best you. (Sound lame but it's true). Apart from that, you will have access to a number of our advisors, world-class investor networks and the company will support you in finding the best operational mentor that we can.

  • Transparent and inclusive

    Work in an environment with high trust, transparency, and autonomy

  • ❤ Community

    Access to the Lived investor community through Antler Global, Airtree, and Folklore which includes invitations to networking events, industry dinners, Slack groups and more

  • Compensation

    Get paid for doing something that you love, that's also changing the world for the better
    Company stock
    WFH budget

  • Growth opportunities

    You're joining at a great time and if you can keep up, you will have the opportunity to grow at the same rate as the company. We will do everything humanly possible in supporting you to get there.

  • World-class science & tech

    Lived has its own network of researchers and engineers, which means the possibilities to innovate, experiment and build are endless! 

‍‍‍ Our team

We are a global, distributed team across Australia and North America (and growing!).

Our team and all of our Guides are made up of people who have lived experience with addiction. People who are living examples of what's possible. People who actually know what it takes.

Our values

Values are actions not just ideas. They inform the way we treat each other and those we support, as well as the products and experiences we build. With a shared understanding of our values, we can go further together.

  • People are the priority. Period.

    Lived is built by and for real people. From the goals we set to the way we hire; the products we build, to the way we speak—people are always the priority. We hire extraordinary humans and look way beyond just their capabilities. Our team don't miss doctor's appointments or our friend's birthdays—because we're people first and employees second. We're building products to drive better human connection and inclusion. We support 'people living with addiction' and never 'addicts'. We thrive on this connection to ourselves, our peers, our community and our cause.

  • Clear is kind

    We are highly transparent and embrace vulnerability—and see the extraordinary power in both of those things. We value inclusivity, direct communication, candid feedback and high respect for one another. Our circle of trust enables us to work better, smarter and faster.

  • Lead with pride

    Shame and stigma have no place in addiction—or at Lived. We couldn't be more proud of the people and community we support, and we sing it loud and proud. Our bold mission is matched by our determination. We stick to our word and will always do what's right over what's easy. We don't shy away from tough conversations, but we always consider who may be listening.

  • Listen carefully

    We never have all of the answers. We never assume. We seek to understand. The conversation around addiction and how we best support people will be constantly evolving—and we'll always be listening, and pushing ourselves to learn and grow.

‍♂ The process we run (so we BOTH know what good likes like)

 

  • Hit apply and follow the prompts If your CV is longer than 2 pages long, try again)

  • A short recorded video interview for us to get to know you better!

  • First interview: You interview the Founder — 40 minutes

    Yup, your opportunity to ask our CEO anything you like, after all this is also about us convincing you to work with us. (not that you will need too much! )

  • Second interview: Founder and another Leader will interview you 30-60 mins

    We will go DEEP on your craft in this one, you will have fun. This will either be with our Head Coach, Head of Product or Head of Marketing but don't worry you will meet them all later in the process. Great leaders want to work with other great leaders.

  • Case study — You present back to the entire team.

    This is your chance to convince the wider team, we are still a small team and we are all about inclusion and involving everyone in the process. This is actually less about the case study and more about your insight, how you communicate, and for us to see how your brain will work. The expectation is you spend no more than an hour or two on this. Likely an interesting operational challenge.

  • Lunch with the team.

    In person If you're a Sydney sider, if not - we can jump on a zoom call.

  • Final culture interview — With someone outside of the business, we trust.

    You will get to meet one of our investors. Depending on who you are will depend on who this might be, they are all incredible operators so this will also be a TREAT.

  • Offer.

    This won't be a shock, we will talk to you about what an offer might look like towards the end of the process and give you the chance to tell us what is important to you.

If we are incredibly excited by you as a future teammate we will fast track this process. If at any stage we decide that there's not a fit we will let you know straight away.

Last but not least: Addiction is a problem that touches every part of society — no matter what gender, racial background, sexual orientation, or religious belief. That's why we are building a team that is just as diverse as the people affected by addiction.

results.title: Climate Analyst
results.description:
SINAI's Climate Team is seeking a Climate Analyst to join our fast-paced and rapidly growing team! Reporting to a Senior Climate Expert at SINAI, you'll have the opportunity to contribute to the success of customer onboarding and product development, to help build and grow the planet's leading decarbonization software! You understand climate science, data analytics, and complex processes, and you're keen to expand your knowledge and share your skills both internally and externally.

To support customer onboarding, management and success, you will be working directly with SINAI's Senior Climate Experts and Customer Experience team, to help our clients measure, calculate and reduce their GHG emissions.

To support internal product development you will provide inputs on climate models, and assist with new feature development and technical issues. This position requires basic knowledge of GHG accounting and global decarbonization opportunities.

There's an opportunity to grow this team much further based on demand, so the dynamics of the role might change accordingly. Initially, you'll be reporting directly to a Senior Climate Expert.

About the Role

Climate Team Tasks / General Support:

  • Help build internal emission factor databases and climate models to be integrated into the SINAI product.
  • Provide technical support to corporate users of Greenhouse Gas Protocol standards and guidance, including providing advice and answering technical questions on the application of the Corporate Standard, Scope 1 and 2 Guidance, and Scope 3 Standard both internally and externally.
  • Provide technical support in the use of Marginal Abatement Cost Curves and other emission reduction strategies.
  • Identify and model applicable decarbonization opportunities for our clients using your understanding of complex, heavy-emitting industries and decarbonization strategy.
  • Support the Climate Team's consulting services aimed at meeting our clients sustainability objectives.
  • Explore new greenhouse gas accounting topics to determine needs for supplementary GHG Protocol standards or guidance.

results.title: Business Operations Analyst
results.description:
Softheon builds software and automation solutions for health insurers and government health agencies. Help shape the future of health tech while working from home with incredible benefits that reflect our commitment to expanding access to quality insurance. Work for a fast-growing, established, and profitable company where you can power what is next in healthcare.

Position Summary

The Business Operations Analyst is responsible for monitoring, analyzing, and improving existing business operations. They will perform basic root cause analysis, support data collection, and gather documentation. They will analyze cross-departmental/cross-product business processes for efficiency, accuracy, timeliness, and completeness.

Within this role the Business Operations Analyst will assist with developing solutions to meet business needs and assist with business development tasks as needed. They participate in company meetings, share ideas to improve current business processes and increase profitability. They follow strict company procedures and report progress to the business operations manager.

They have excellent time management skills, communication skills, are self-motivated and have a strong attention to detail. They can write basic standard operations procedures.

Requirements

Key Responsibilities (include but not limited to):

  • Understand end to end business process and workflow.
  • Monitor system performance using various tools to ensure all processes are performing as designed.
  • Review ADO tickets and resolve or escalate issues identified by clients or internal staff.
  • Document investigational steps and preliminary root cause analysis for product escalation.
  • Self-manage completing assigned daily tasks.
  • Communicate issues with product performance to Product Managers and track for resolution.
  • Resolve exception escalations timely to meet client expectations.
  • Monitor Service Level Agreement (SLA) metrics and resolve issues timely to ensure SLAs are met.
  • Understand and perform standard operational procedures to ensure processes are accurate, timely and complete.
  • Assist with testing by completing assigned test cases for client onboarding, open enrollment, and pre/post deployment.
  • Proactively communicate and collaborate with Product Managers to define and solve issues.
  • Write detailed reports based on your recommendations and communicate your findings (inwriting and through presentations) to upper management.
  • Identify new opportunities, service improvements and cost reduction for continuous process improvement and scalability.
  • Communicate complex data in comprehensible ways.
  • Determine, implement, and evaluate business metrics to meet ongoing organizational or customer information needs.
Qualifications
  • A Bachelor's Degree or higher in Business Administration, Economics, Computer Science, or Informational Technology with a GPA of 3.5 or higher.
  • One to three years’ work experience required.
  • SQL experience required.
  • Proficient in MS Word, MS Excel, and Outlook.
  • Experience working with and creating Standard Operating Procedures (SOP) documents.
  • Exceptional critical thinking and problem-solving skills.
  • Ability to investigate, analyze and automate solutions to resolve data patterns and trends in exception queues.
  • Exceptional verbal and written communication skills.

Benefits

When you join Softheon, you will:

  • Have an opportunity to add value to a diverse team of innovative professionals
  • Rise to new challenges everyday
  • Receive competitive salary and career growth opportunities

Softheon is an equal opportunities employer. We strongly believe that employing a diverse workforce is key to our success. We make recruitment hiring decisions based on each candidate's experience and skills. We value your passion to make healthcare affordable, accessible, and plentiful.

ABOUT US:

As a leading software development company, Softheon offers the decision to work remotely or in-office. Softheon earned multiple placements on the Inc. 5000 in recent years due to its rapid growth. Softheon’s rich benefits offerings include unlimited PTO, 401(k) matching, and 80% of health care premiums paid.

Founded in 2000, Softheon’s Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) and Business Process-as-a-Service (BPaaS) solutions solve complex challenges for health plans and government health agencies. Currently, Softheon’s solutions serve 8 State agencies and over 80 health plans.

Issuers and consumers utilizing Medicaid, Medicare, and the ACA Marketplace benefit from Softheon’s innovative technology that reduces administrative overhead and enhances user-experiences.

To find out more about Softheon please visit www.softheon.com.

To all recruitment agencies: Softheon does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to Softheon employees or any other company location. Softheon is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes and will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with the Company.

results.title: New Business Strategy, MBA Internship (Summer 2023)
results.description:
Lincoln Avenue Capital is seeking a New Business Strategy intern to join our firm this summer. This individual will be responsible for working with our Executive-level team on sourcing, analyzing, structuring, and financing new business opportunities in the real estate investment space. As a 10–12-week paid Summer Internship, this is an opportunity to develop critical business acumen and skills as you build long-term growth plans that have the potential to impact our business and mission for years to come. Through our dynamic program, you will gain practical and hands-on experience to help you meet your educational goals and prepare you for a real estate, finance, or private equity career.

At this time, we are only considering MBA students who are graduating in Spring 2024.

 

What You'll Do

  • Conduct primary research on expansion opportunities in any market.
  • Lead the development of a long-term growth plan and underwriting standards.
  • Determine the strengths and weaknesses of various new business opportunities while considering the impact on the Founders' overall investment strategy and social impact goals.
  • Work with the Executive team to create recommendations for market expansion and large-scale investment opportunities.
  • Present recommendations to the investment committee with oversight from senior leaders, including LAC's Co-Founders.
  • Investigate and analyze market rules, regulations, industry trends, or other documents.
  • Analytical tasks including modeling of investment opportunities.

Requirements

  • MBA candidate (Spring 2024) with exceptional academic performance and experience in finance and/or real estate.
  • Real estate, private equity, or structured credit experience preferred.
  • Experience in financial modeling.
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
  • Strong oral and written communication skills.
  • Strong project management skills with the ability to prioritize and manage daily tasks.

Benefits

  • The compensation range is $10,000 -- $12,500 per month, depending on experience and location.
  • Interns can be remote, though there is a preference for this role to be in the New York City or Santa Monica Office. Ideally, the intern would commit to being in the office 3+ days out of the week between Monday through Thursday.
  • We provide a monthly stipend for out-of-area interns working in NYC or LA.
  • We offer a temporary remote set-up for your home & free catered lunches whenever you are in the office.
